DOC.brief_summary: This study investigate effect robot-aided 2-day proprioceptive training wrist proprioceptive motor function wrist/hand complex patient proprioceptive impairment . The wrist proprioceptive training consist active movement training augment haptic vibro-tactile feedback provide patented wrist robotic system ( US Serial No . 62/136,065 ) . This study protocol apply variety clinical non-clinical population . The purpose study obtain preliminary data effectiveness proprioceptive training subject cortical stroke peripheral sensory neuropathy .
DOC.detailed_description: This protocol seek improve proprioceptive-motor function . Proprioception refers perception limb position motion orientation one 's body space . Numerous medical condition motor symptom also associate proprioceptive loss , osteoarthritis , Parkinson 's disease , peripheral sensory neuropathy , stroke , developmental coordination disorder . However , therapy improve proprioceptive function population either non-existent limited scope although establish proprioceptive impairment severely degrade motor function . The propose protocol focus proprioception fine motor function hand/wrist joint complex , hand/wrist motor control highly important activity daily live . The specific aim determine 2-day wrist proprioceptive training : 1. improves limb position sense acuity , 2. improves spatial precision wrist/hand motor task , 3. increase efficiency perform motor task , 4. associate neural change cortical processing measure short-latency somatosensory evoke potential ( SEP ) motor evoke potential ( MEP ) use transcranial magnetic stimulation . The study follow crossover design two arm two group . Time frame completion study 7 day depend start day week ( Monday Friday ) . No test occur weekend . Group 1 follow time frame : Day 1 : pre-test ( approx . 3 hr . ) train intervention ( approx . 30 min. ) . Day 2 : training intervention ( approx . 30 min . ) post-test 1 ( approx . 3 hrs. ) . Days 3-6 : Usual care ( min . 2 day require ) . Days 5-7 : Post-test 2 ( depend start day week , either Day 5,6 , 7 ) . Group 2 follow time frame : Day 1 : pre-test 1 ( approx . 3 hrs. ) . DOC.criteria: For participant ( healthy patient population ) 1. wrist passive range motion ( ROM ) 22.5° flexion/extension 2. sense vibrotactile cue either forearm order effectively receive movementrelated feedback 3. resist minimal resistance gravityeliminated position ( score least 2+/5 physical examination manual muscle test ( Hislop , Avers , & Brown , 2013 ) ) ) wrist movement direction . 1 . Regular intake benzodiazepine . 2 . Cognitive impairment : score ≥ 23 Minimental state examination ( Folstein , Robins & Helzer , 1983 ) 3 . Depressive symptom : score ≤ 19 Beck depression inventory ( Beck , Steer , & Carbin,1988 ) . Inclusion Criteria Stroke Subjects 1. least 3 month stroke 2. whose age 30 75 year old . Exclusion Criteria Subjects undergo TMS procedure ( Rossi , Hallett , Rossini , & PascualLeone , 2009 ) Has implant metal body .
